page.title: 16HEMEL HEMPSTEAD PEOPLE
page.content: A small survey has been conducted from a few schools in Hemel Hempstead. This has aimed at finding out how people feel about living in the town. The majority of responses have come from the 25-60 age group. More of those responding appear to be content with living in the town than those who wish to leave. Of the people who wish to move, about half still wish to be in Hemel Hempstead but in a different neighbourhood. This would suggest that even though people have moved to the town for a variety of reasons: after marriage,for a job, brought by parents for example, they do find it a sufficiently pleasant place to remain. This view is reflected in the under 25 age group although there were very few responses from this group.
